reference.title: Generic Container Comparison & Examples
reference.shortdesc: HTML has two types of generic containers: in-line (<span>) and block-level (<div>). Examples of their different uses may help you choose the proper generic container.

row.entry: In-line generic container. <span> should be used to contain small sections of content that do not stand alone.
A single letter in a word, a single word in a sentence, or a single sentence in a paragraph.
Block-level generic container. <div> should be used to contain larger blocks or complete sections of content.
An entire paragraph, a section of a document.
